comment: Just because a class is simple does not mean it is one worth taking. It is an easy A if you do the work, but lectures were boring and didn't teach anything. All learning was based on doing learnsmarts, then all she did in class was little personality test things. Big group project with essays graded pickier than english classes. Tests are online.

Attendance is mandatory, and she gives long lectures every class and they are pretty dry. Tests aren't overly hard and the quizzes are unlimited attempts. Group work is a major component of this course. Pick your group wisely.

One of the most unorganized teachers I have ever taken. She takes FOREVER to grade assignments. It's finals week and I haven't received half my grades. Her tests are difficult because they're poorly written and gives you very little time. Her grading & feedback does not make sense. She will set you up for failure. I would NOT recommend taking her!

Overall, her class was easy. Quizzes online with unlimited attempts, 2 in class exams, 2 online. No cumulative final. Never had homework. There is a group project which is a majority of the grade.  She really appreciates students participating in class.

Professor Vasa-Sideris has been recently transitioned to the Kennesaw campus. Her lectures seem disorganized at times, de-railing and focusing around irrelevant subjects. During my class, she has been disrespectful to numerous students, snapping at them when they ask normal questions and taking up a very condescending tone. Not very professional.

Very nice. Creates environment for learning as she is very encouraging. Attendance isn't mandatory, but I worth participation grade. Would take in future, would recommend. 2 exams and one group project. a quiz for the chapters. Barely used my book at all.

Takes more than 4 weeks to give back grades. Uses another professor's resources to "teach". Doesn't teach. She writes a few words on the board talks about how it related to her when she was as student/worker. Tests are incredibly difficult. You must teach yourself. Gives study guides that result in more than 7 pages. Rude. Avoid her

There is a lot of work.  Tests can be difficult as questions aren't written well.  Dr. S is very helpful.  Downside slow at grading, but its because she reads everything and provides feedback! Better than what most professors do.

Nice lady. But homeworkdiscussion topics for the online course were strangely unrelated to test questions. 60% of the grade comes from 4 tests which are in overly complex written essay style format. Questions are written to confuse rather then show what you know. Grades are completely subjective and are not posted timely! Wouldn't recommend her.
Liked the set up for the course and that she was always quick to respond to any questions, but grading wasn't even remotely timely.

She is very easy. Quiz & test are in 2 parts. Part 1, multiple choice 50%, part 2, discussion 50%. Multiple choice questions are directly from the book. Discussion questions are from discussions in the text. EASY CLASS BUT SHE IS EXTREMELY LAZY. it took her 1 mnth to grade our 1st exam.Looks like our final grade won't be posted for a while. SHAME!
Do reading  & project & go to class & you will do fine. Dr V is a fine teacher.
She is a good Professor and very happy to give help. Easy A if you put effort.

She is an okay professor. If you take her for a night class, or a 3-hour class, expect to literally stay there to the minute the class is over. She does not finish early and takes attendance. She knows her stuff but class can become boring sometimes
Best instructor at SPSU
She is great! She goes out of her way to help you succeed.

Great teacher, knows the subject matter pretty well.  Class can become pretty dull at times (most of the stuff is common sense that can be learned just through life experiences and jobs), but she tries to keep it interesting.  Would recommend her
Can be rude sometimes.  Easy teacher but bad attitude.
I took her over the summer and it was really easy. She is nice and helpful. Do your work and you will be fine. I made an A in the class.

A lot of reading and a lot of writing (web journal and web discussion groups).  However, if you participate in the discussions and keep your journal going as related to the course content, you will have no problem.  Grades by comparing writing to other classmates - you set the bar.  Highly subjective.
